result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey B. Jerome was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
SENTENCED TO 8 YEARS IN THE WI STATE PRISON SYSTEM. 5 YEARS INITIAL CONFINEMENT.
Consecutive to: CONSECUTIVE TO COUNT 2

PROVIDED DNA SAMPLE IF NOT ALREADY DONE

records.addlTxt: Amendment to Judgment of Conviction EAP
to Court from DOC

Amendment to Judgement of Conviction-ERP
s/BNB/5-1-17
AMENDED

Defendant Corey B. Jerome in court with attorney Cole Daniel Ruby.  Defendant Corey B. Jerome in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF53 & 14CM118 tracking together:
Atty Hendee states that there is resolution to the matters.  Atty Hendee will be filing an amended information with adding Ct. 2 to 14CF53.  Atty Hendee asks that the court remove the repeater on Ct. 1 in 14CF53.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 2.  14CM1018 to be dismissed.  Atty Ruby agrees with the agreement.
BY THE COURT:  Court will accept the amended information adding Ct. 2 on 14CF53.  On Ct. 1, the court will remove the repeater.

Atty Hendee files the amended information.    Atty Ruby states that the Defendant received a copy of the amended information & waives it's reading.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2.  14CM118 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee is not requesting a PSI.  Atty Ruby agrees and will not be asking for a PSI.
BY THE COURT:  No PSI ordered per request.

Atty Hendee states sentencing recommendations and asks the court to follow the recommendation.  
Atty Ruby makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1, repeater removed:  Impose and Stay: 8 years in the Wisconsin State Prison System with 5 years Initial Confinement and 3 years Extended Supervision with conditions:
*Court orders 5 years Probation with conditions; consecutive to Prison sentence in Ct. 2; concurrent to any other probation 
*Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge 
*Comply with any and all counseling or treatment recommended by the Agent
*Absolute Sobriety
*Any other counseling recommended by the Agent
Credit = 0 days

Ct. 2:  Court orders 4 years in the Wisconsin State Priston System with 2 years Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended Supervision with conditions; consecutive to current sentence:
Court Costs = $268.00
*DNA Sample (if not done so already) + $250.00 Surcharge
*Comply with all conditions recommended by the Agent
*Not eligible for Challange Incarceration Program 
*Eligible for Substance Abuse Program (determined by the DOC)
Credit = 0 days
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.

14CM118 to be dismissed.

Defendant Corey B. Jerome in court, in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF53 & 13CM118:
  Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint's in both matters & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant states that he does have counsel but was unable to be here today.  Defendant requests a Preliminary Hearing; does not waive time limits.  Atty Hendee requests the name of the Attorney.  Defendant states Atty Ruby.
Atty Hendee requests a $5,000 cash bond that covers both cases with conditions:
No contact with Christel Jerome except by writing while in custody.
BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 cash bond with conditions on both cases:
*No contact with Christel Jerome except by writing while in custody.

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.
